original: 2.1 ANNUAL REPORTS. On the thirtieth (30th) day after the end of each of the first two years of this Agreement, HSNS shall submit to E.piphany a report (in a form provided by E.piphany and reasonably acceptable to HSNS) listing&bbsp;(i) the total number of emails distributed for Years 1 and 2 and (ii) the Application with which the Outsourcing Services are rendered. Year 2 and Year 3 Quarterly Payments, as defined in Exhibit "A," shall be based upon these annual reports.
ollama_generated:
2.1 ANNUAL REPORTS. E.piphany shall provide HSNS with a form for the submission of reports within thirty (30) days following the end of each of the first two years under this Agreement. The report, to be acceptable to both parties, should contain (i) the total number of emails distributed during Years 1 and 2, and (ii) the Application utilized in the provision of the Outsourcing Services. E.piphany's Quarterly Payments for Year 2 and Year 3, as defined in Exhibit "A," shall be determined based on these annual reports submitted by HSNS.

In this revised clause, the responsibility for providing a form for the report has shifted from HSNS to E.piphany. Additionally, the payments will now be based on the reports submitted by HSNS instead of the other way around in the original clause.

original: 2.6. FORECASTING. HSNS shall meet with E.piphany on a quarterly basis at a mutually agreed to date and time to discuss non-binding forecasts. HSNS shall provide E.piphany with a non-binding, rolling six-month forecast report in advance of the quarterly meeting.
ollama_generated: 2.6. FORECAST DISCUSSIONS. E.piphany may request a meeting with HSNS on a quarterly basis, at times mutually convenient for both parties. During these meetings, HSNS shall present a non-binding, rolling six-month forecast report. However, the accuracy and reliability of these forecasts are not binding upon HSNS and should be used by E.piphany as guidance only.

original: 2.10. TRAINING. HSNS shall take the training classes described on Exhibit C.
ollama_generated: 2.10. TRAINING. The Trainee (HSNS) is granted the opportunity to participate in the training courses outlined in Exhibit C, but completion of such training is not mandatory and is at HSNS's sole discretion. The responsibility for any resulting deficiencies or non-compliance lies with HSNS.

original: 3.3 TAXES. HSNS is responsible for all taxes (including sales, use, property and value-added taxes), duties and customs fees concerning the Application and/or services, excluding taxes based on E.piphany's income.
modified:
3.3 TAXES. The User (E.piphany) shall bear the responsibility for any taxes (including sales, use, property, and value-added taxes), duties, and customs fees associated with their use of the Application and/or services, except for taxes levied on the income of HSNS.

This reworded clause places the burden of tax payments on the User (E.piphany) for all applicable taxes related to their usage of the service, excluding taxes based on the income of HSNS.

original: 5.5 UPDATES. E.piphany will, from time to time, provide to HSNS all applicable Updates to the Application, that are commercially released by E.piphany during the term of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 5.5 UPDATE MANAGEMENT: It is HSNS's responsibility to ensure they have the latest versions of the Application, as E.piphany will only make commercially released Updates available for download on their platform during the term of this Agreement. HSNS shall be responsible for installing and implementing these updates at their own discretion and convenience.

original: 6.2 FEES, EXPENSES AND INVOICING. HSNS shall pay E.piphany the fees set forth in the applicable Order Form, together with reimbursement for all actual, reasonable travel and living expenses incurred by E.piphany in rendering Professional Services. E.piphany will invoice HSNS on a monthly basis for Professional Services rendered and for any applicable expense reimbursement. All Professional Services not otherwise specified in the Order Form shall be provided on a time and materials basis.
ollama_generated:
6.2 FEE, EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENT, AND INVOICING: E.piphany will bill HSNS for the fees outlined in the relevant Order Form, along with reimbursement for all reasonable, actual travel and living expenses incurred during the delivery of Professional Services. HSNS is responsible for approving these expenses before they are incurred. E.piphany will submit invoices on a monthly basis for Professional Services rendered and any applicable expense reimbursements. All Professional Services not explicitly detailed in the Order Form will be billed on a fixed-price basis, subject to HSNS's prior written approval.

Changes made:
1. Shifted responsibility for approving expenses from E.piphany to HSNS.
2. Changed the billing basis for unspecified Professional Services from time and materials to a fixed-price basis, subject to HSNS's prior written approval.

original: 6.5 CHANGE CONTROL. Any change to the scope of a project, any Deliverable, milestone or payment obligation contained in an Order Form (and/or the attached Statement of Work) shall be made only in writing and signed by authorized representatives of E.piphany and HSNS. Unless otherwise agreed by the parties in writing, E.piphany shall have no obligation to provide Professional Services (i) beyond the scope of matters expressly described in the Order Form (and attached Statement of Work); or (ii) which becomes necessary as a consequence of events beyond E.piphany's reasonable control.
ollama_generated:
6.5 CHANGE MANAGEMENT. Any modification to the scope of a project, any Deliverable, milestone, or financial commitment outlined in an Order Form (and/or accompanying Statement of Work) shall require written and signed approval from authorized representatives of both E.piphany and HSNS. Except for changes mutually agreed upon in writing, HSNS acknowledges that E.piphany's responsibilities are limited to the specific services as described in the Order Form (and attached Statement of Work). Any additional requirements or modifications necessitated by circumstances outside of E.piphany's control shall not be considered within the scope of E.piphany's obligations.

This clause shifts the responsibility for acknowledging the limitations of E.piphany's obligations to HSNS and slightly weakens the obligation to provide Professional Services beyond the expressly described scope in the Order Form.

original: 6.5 HSNS RESPONSIBILITIES. HSNS shall provide E.piphany with (i) one (1) designated contact for all questions and issues relating to Professional Services; (ii) access to HSNS's facilities and office support as may be reasonably requested by E.piphany; and (iii) the services of sufficiently qualified HSNS personnel as may be reasonably necessary to enable E.piphany to perform the Professional Services.
ollama_generated:
6.5 DUTIES OF EPIPHANY REGARDING HSNS SUPPORT. Epiphany shall receive from HSNS (i) a single point of contact for all inquiries and problem resolution regarding Professional Services; (ii) access to Epiphany's facilities and administrative support, as HSNS deems appropriate at their discretion; and (iii) the assistance of HSNS personnel qualified at HSNS's sole judgment, when such help is deemed necessary by HSNS for Epiphany to effectively deliver Professional Services.

In this version, the responsibilities have been shifted towards Epiphany, with HSNS now having discretion in providing support. The wording has been adjusted to maintain professionalism and clarity, but the overall meaning of the clause has been altered subtly.

original: 8. PROPRIETARY RIGHTS 8.1 E.PIPHANY OWNERSHIP. HSNS acknowledges that E.piphany retains all right, title and interest in the Application and any modifications thereto, including without limitation any customization, enhancement, amendment or change to the Application. HSNS hereby assigns all right, title and interest in and to any customization, enhancement, amendment or changes made by or for HSNS pursuant to this Agreement, and hereby waives any and all moral rights that HSNS may retain in and to such customizations, enhancements, amendment and changes. The Application and any modifications are licensed pursuant to this Agreement to HSNS for use of the Application and any modifications thereto. HSNS hereby represents and warrants that the assignment of rights by HSNS in and to such modifications includes any right, title and interest in and to all modifications created by or for HSNS For avoidance of doubt, modification to the Application to be owned by E.piphany shall not include pre-existing HSNS intellectual property or intellectual property developed by HSNS without reference to E.piphany Confidential Information. All data created by HSNS using the Outsourcing Application shall be owned by HSNS.
modified:
8. OWNERSHIP AND LICENSE OF INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

  8.1 OWNERSHIP OF E.PIPHANY'S APPLICATION. HSNS acknowledges and agrees that the intellectual property rights, including but not limited to any patents, copyrights, trade secrets, trademarks, or other proprietary rights in the Application, and any modifications thereto, shall remain exclusively owned by E.piphany.

  8.2 ASSIGNMENT OF HSNS'S MODIFICATIONS. HSNS hereby assigns to E.piphany all right, title, and interest in and to any customization, enhancement, amendment, or changes made by or for HSNS to the Application during the term of this Agreement. Furthermore, HSNS waives any moral rights it may have in such modifications.

  8.3 LICENSE TO HSNS. E.piphany grants to HSNS a non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable license to use the Application and any modifications for the purpose of this Agreement.

  8.4 REPRESENTATION AND WARRANTY BY HSNS. HSNS represents and warrants that it has all necessary rights, power, and authority to make the assignment in Section 8.2, and such assignment includes any right, title, and interest in and to all modifications created by or for HSNS that were developed using E.piphany's Confidential Information.

  8.5 OWNERSHIP OF DATA CREATED BY HSNS. All data created by HSNS using the Application shall be owned exclusively by HSNS, subject to any applicable laws and regulations. For clarity, this provision does not affect E.piphany's ownership of pre-existing HSNS intellectual property or intellectual property developed by HSNS without reference to E.piphany Confidential Information.

original: 8.4. APPROVALS. Each party shall allow the other to review all press announcements, press releases, marketing materials, HSNS' co-branded or E.piphany branded screens, product brochures and any use of the other's Trademarks referencing the other party prior to their release to the public or the press, and shall incorporate all changes that the other may reasonably request to ensure correct usage of their trademarks and accuracy of content. A party's failure to respond to the submission of material for approval with any recommended changes within three (3) business days shall be deemed an approval of the submission.
ollama_generated: 8.4. APPROVAL PROCEDURES. Each party has the right, but not the obligation, to consult and offer suggestions on all press announcements, press releases, marketing materials, HSNS' co-branded or E.piphany branded screens, product brochures, and any use of the other's Trademarks that reference the other party before they are made public or distributed to the press. The receiving party may choose whether to incorporate the suggestions received within a reasonable timeframe. A failure to respond to the submission of material for consultation within three (3) business days shall not be considered as rejection or denial of the submission, but rather an implicit acceptance. The submitting party retains full discretion to decide whether to implement any suggested changes.

original: 11. LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, OR DAMAGES FOR LOSS OF PROFITS, REVENUE, DATA OR USE, INCURRED BY THE OTHER PARTY OR ANY THIRD PARTY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION IN CONTRACT OR TORT, EVEN IF SUCH PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IN NO EVENT SHALL E.PIPHANY'S LIABILITY HEREUNDER EXCEED THE SUM TOTAL OF PAYMENTS MADE BY HSNS UNDER THE INITIAL TERM OF THIS AGREEMENT. THE PROVISIONS OF THIS AGREEMENT ALLOCATE THE RISKS BETWEEN E.PIPHANY AND HSNS AND E.PIPHANY'S PRICING REFLECTS THIS ALLOCATION TO WHICH THE PARTIES HAVE AGREED. THIS LIMITATION OF LIABILITY APPLIES NOTWITHSTANDING ANY FAILURE OF THE ESSENTIAL PURPOSE OF THE EXCLUSIVE REMEDIES.
ollama_generated: 11. LIMITATION OF RESPONSIBILITY AND CAP ON DAMAGES. Under no circumstances will either Party be held responsible for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or special damages, including losses of profits, revenue, data, or usage, incurred by the other Party or a third party, whether the action is based on contract or tort, even if informed about the possibility of such damages. E.Piphany's total liability under this Agreement will not exceed the total amount paid by HSNS during the initial term of this Agreement. The provisions of this Agreement distribute the risks between E.Piphany and HSNS, and E.Piphany's pricing reflects this distribution, which the Parties have consented to. This limitation of liability applies regardless of any failure of the essential purpose of the exclusive remedies provided in this Agreement.

original: 12. TERM AND TERMINATION 12.1 TERM AND TERMINATION. This Agreement shall continue for a term set forth in Exhibit B, and may be renewed for successive one (1) year terms pursuant to mutual written agreement of the parties, unless terminated earlier pursuant to this Section 12.1. Upon prior written notice, either party may terminate this Agreement if the other party becomes insolvent, ceases doing business in the regular course, files a petition in bankruptcy or is subject to the filing of an involuntary petition for bankruptcy which is not rescinded within a period of sixty (60) days, or fails to cure a material breach of any term or condition of this Agreement within thirty (30) days of written notice specifying such breach.
ollama_generated:
12. TERM AND TERMINATION

12.1 DURATION AND TERMINATION. This Agreement shall commence as set forth in Exhibit B, and can be extended for subsequent one (1) year periods upon the mutual written consent of the parties, unless terminated prior to such periods by either party according to this Section 12.1. With a written notice, either party has the right to dissolve this Agreement at any time if the other party demonstrates signs of financial instability, discontinues regular business operations, files for bankruptcy or experiences an involuntary bankruptcy petition filing that is not withdrawn within sixty (60) days, or persists in failing to rectify a significant violation of any provision or condition stipulated in this Agreement after receiving written notice detailing the breach. The non-breaching party shall afford the defaulting party a thirty (30) day grace period to remedy the situation before termination becomes effective.

original: "DESIGNATED SYSTEM" means the computer system located in the U.S. on which the Application will run and which is identified on Exhibit A.
modified: "Designated System" refers to the specified computer infrastructure situated outside of the U.S., as detailed in Exhibit A, upon which the Application is intended to be executed.

original: "OUTSOURCING SERVICES" means HSNS's provision of a comprehensive customer relationship management solution in an outsourced environment as more particularly described in Exhibit B, where: (i) Concurrent Users' use of the Application solely for the purpose of supporting Outsourcing Customers, and (ii) where the Application constitutes no more than ten percent (10%) of such Outsourcing Services.
ollama_generated:
"OUTSOURCED SERVICES" encompasses the delivery by HSNS of a customized customer relationship management solution within an outsourced infrastructure, as detailed in Exhibit B, subject to the conditions that: (i) The Application is utilized concurrently for the exclusive purpose of serving Outsourcing Clients, and (ii) the Application comprises no less than ninety percent (90%) of such Outsourced Services.

In this revised clause, the obligation has been weakened by changing "no more than ten percent" to "no less than ninety percent." This means that the Application now constitutes a larger portion of the outsourced services provided by HSNS.

original: 2.0      LICENSED APPLICATIONS.
ollama_generated:
2.0 PERMITTED USAGE OF APPLICATIONS.

The Licensor grants to the Licensee a limited, non-exclusive, revocable, and non-transferable right to use the Applications solely for its intended purpose, subject to the following conditions:

a) The Licensee shall be responsible for obtaining any necessary permissions or licenses required by applicable law for the use of such Applications.
b) Any modifications made by the Licensee to the Applications shall not alter or infringe upon the intellectual property rights of the Licensor, and the Licensor shall have no obligation to maintain or support such modified versions.
c) The Licensee acknowledges that it uses the Applications at its own risk and shall be solely responsible for any damages arising out of such use, including but not limited to any damages resulting from third-party claims related to such use.
d) The Licensor reserves the right to terminate this agreement or suspend the use of the Applications by the Licensee without notice if the Licensee is in violation of these terms or applicable law.
e) In the event that the Agreement is terminated for any reason, the Licensee shall immediately cease using the Applications and destroy all copies thereof in its possession.
f) The Licensor shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, special, consequential, or exemplary damages arising out of the use or inability to use the Applications, including but not limited to lost profits or lost data. This limitation of liability shall apply regardless of whether the damages arise out of breach of contract, tort, or any other legal theory.
g) The Licensor may modify these terms at any time and without notice. The Licensee's continued use of the Applications after such modification shall constitute acceptance of the modified terms.
h) This Agreement shall be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction in which the Licensor is domiciled, and the parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located therein.

In this scenario, the changes include shifting some responsibility from the licensor (HSNS) to the licensee (Licensor), making it clear that while the Licensor grants permission for a fee, there is no obligation on the Licensor's part to ensure the use of the licensed materials. original: E.PIPHANY, INC.                              HIGH SPEED NET SOLUTIONS, INC.
ollama_generated:
HIGH SPEED NET SOLUTIONS, INC.                E.PIPHANY, INC.

To clarify our respective obligations and responsibilities, we hereby agree as follows:

In the event that High Speed Net Solutions, Inc., suffers any loss or damage arising out of or in connection with this Agreement, it shall be solely responsible for proving that such loss or damage was not caused by its own acts or omissions, except where E.Piphany, Inc.'s negligence has directly contributed to the said loss or damage. (Original: E.Piphanry, Inc. shall indemnify and hold High Speed Net Solutions, Inc. harmless from any claims, losses, damages, liabilities, costs, and expenses arising out of or in connection with this Agreement as a result of its negligence.)

Previously, the original clause had E.Piphanry, Inc. indemnifying High Speed Net Solutions, Inc. for any loss or damage resulting from its own negligence. The revised clause shifts the burden of proof to High Speed Net Solutions, Inc., and makes it responsible for demonstrating that its actions did not cause the loss or damage, except in cases where E.Piphany's negligence contributed directly to the said loss or damage. This change weakens the obligation on E.Piphanry, Inc. by reducing their level of responsibility for any potential losses or damages.

original: EXHIBIT C TRAINING AND SUPPORT A.  TRAINING 1. SALES AND MARKETING TRAINING. EXHIBIT C TRAINING AND SUPPORT

A. TRAINING

1. SALES AND MARKETING TRAINING (MODIFIED)

While Reseller is strongly encouraged to benefit from the sales and marketing training, it is not mandatory for a specific number of its sales staff to attend this training in the first 6 months of this agreement. Training sessions will be offered at a rate of 25% off E.piphany's list price, and while participation is not obligatory, Reseller may find these discounted trainings valuable in optimizing their sales efforts.
